title: (x) www.three.co.uk - Verona, Modena {Yves}
content:
Hi, this musta been answered before, but I can't seem to get search box working - sorry!   
   
The 3G operator [www.three.co.uk](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826045739/http:/www.three.co.uk/) uses two fonts, one serifed and one sans.   
   
Are these public fonts or custom made for Hutchinson Three?
author: anonymous

comments.content: Aren't that the [Miles Newlyn faces](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826045739/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19575.html) Verona and Modena?

Whoa, thanks for the fast reply. :-)   
   
Indeed, what fine typography they are.

I looked at Yves link there (I must have missed that thread originally) and the post says I had "Modena" on my site, but that font was actually ["ModenA"](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826045739/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script06Pg15.html) by Zhivko Stankulov of Fonteam International. Miles Newlyn personally had supplied about 4 or 5 samples for the Script Guide (Ferox, Bugini & Luvbug with variations), but Modena wasn't one of them.

Oops! I DID have Modena, but it was in the [Sans ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826045739/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script06Pg15.html) (at the bottom of the page). The sample he gave me of this must have used a different version of the 'y', because what I show doesn't match that letter in the other post of Modena that Yves linked.

Just a follow-up. Coincidentally, I heard from Miles Newlyn with an ID question yesterday and mentioned to him about this thread. He wrote this morning and said the font is Modena Condensed (no 'r' in the font name) and that it was 'a custom redraw with some very odd characteristics (ie the huge x height, and the unique y)'.   
   
He also said that Modena (pure) will be available next year.
Removed the 'r' from the name. D'oh! ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826045739im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/blush.gif)
